text:
I'm Cloud Computing Option
Head and an instructor

with the School of Computing
and Academic Studies

at British Columbia Institute
of Technology or BCIT.

In our department, the
School of Computing, we have
two two year diploma programs.
One of the diplomas is focused on

Students that wanna be
software developers.

And the other's focused
on students that wanna be

Systems Administrators,
they don't wanna program

but they wanna be involved
in installing systems,
networking and things like that.

And we also have a small
Bachelor of Technology Program.

In total, we have, we
take in about 350 students

every year and so we're
running about 700 concurrent
students in these three programs.
So most of the students that come to take

our computing programs want to
get hands on technical skills
as quickly as possible.

They already come knowing
a good idea of what they
wanna do career wise.

They don't wanna take
a lot of extra courses
and they really wanna learn to program

or build systems and they
get jobs in the local
local tech industries.

So about five years ago
we really realized that

having a Cloud Computing
Course in our curriculum
was gonna be very important because we saw
where Amazon Web Services were going
and we knew this was gonna be a future

for a lot of companies
even though the companies
at the time, didn't realize it.

So AWS Educate makes it
really easy for students

to enroll and get access
to the AWS Platform
through the credits are really amazing.
I think we've all been in the situation

where we graduate from
college and we start

applying for our first
jobs and a lot of times,
employers say what experience do you have?

And with our program, all of
the students can put at least

that they've worked on
two real world projects
with different companies.

I think AWS Educate makes it
really easy for professors
like myself to get on to the cloud.

There's so many resources
at AWS Educate has online.
Good lab materials,
really good documentation and I think
it's really up to them let's just say,

what kind of skill AWS
skills do we want to

teach our students but for
me it was really easy to

enroll myself and there
was enough material

in labs that I could
easily build quite a bit

of my curriculum simply
from the sample materials
that were available online.
